verses: Speak unto the children of Israel, and take of every one of them
rod according to the house of
fathers, of all their princes according to the house of their fathers twelve rods: write thou every man’s name upon his rod.
And thou shalt write Aaron’s name upon the rod of Levi: for one rod
for the head of the house of their fathers.
And thou shalt lay them up in the
before the testimony, where I will
And it shall come to pass,
the man’s rod, whom I shall
, shall blossom: and I will make to cease from me the murmurings of the children of Israel, whereby they murmur against you.
And Moses spake unto the children of Israel, and every one of their
gave him a rod apiece, for each prince one, according to their fathers’ houses,
twelve rods: and the rod of Aaron
And Moses laid up the rods before the

And it came to pass, that on the morrow Moses went into the tabernacle of witness; and, behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi was budded, and brought forth buds, and bloomed blossoms, and yielded almonds.
And Moses brought out all the rods from before the
unto all the children of Israel: and they looked, and took every man his rod.
rod again before the testimony, to be kept for a token against the rebels; and thou shalt quite take away their murmurings from me, that they die not.
And the children of Israel spake unto Moses, saying, Behold, we die, we perish, we all perish.
near unto the tabernacle of the
OR are we all to die?
